{{Infobox person | name = Yuri Velykanovych | image = Yuri_Velykanovych.png | caption = A photo of Yuri Velykanovych during his participation in the International Brigades | native_name = Ю́рій Дми́трович Великано́вич | native_name_lang = [[Ukrainian language]] | birth_date = 1910 | birth_place = [[Turka, Ukraine|Turka]], [[Galicia (Eastern Europe)|Galicia]],
{{flag|Austria-Hungary}}
(now {{flag|Ukraine}}) | death_date = September 7, 1938 | death_place = [[Ebro Valley]],
{{flag|Spanish Republic}} | death_cause = Mortally wounded in a battle | monuments = [[Lviv]] (demoilshed) | citizenship = {{flagicon image|Flag of Poland.svg}} [[Second Polish Republic|Polish Republic]] | alma_mater = [[Ivan Franko National University of Lviv|Jan Kazimierz University]] | occupation = Journalist | party = [[Communist Party of Western Ukraine]] }} '''Yuri Dmytrovych Velykanovych '''(ukr. Ю́рій Дми́трович Великано́вич; 1910, [[Turka, Ukraine|Turka]], [[Galicia (Eastern Europe)|Galicia]], [[Austria-Hungary]], September 7, 1938, [[Ebro Valley]], [[Second Spanish Republic|Spanish Republic]]) was a participant in the [[Spanish Civil War]], Ukrainian interbrigadist, member of the [[Communist Party of Western Ukraine]] (CPWU).{{Cite journal|last=Anatoliy Georgievuch|first=Morozov|last2=Кompaniyets|first2=Alex Viktorovuch|date=2017-06-14|title=The participation of ukrainians in the struggle againts[sic] fascism and nazism before world war II (from the experience of the spanish civil war 1936–1939)|url=http://history-ejournal.cdu.edu.ua/article/view/1256|journal=Cherkasy University Bulletin: Historical Sciences|language=en|volume=0|issue=1|pages=|issn=2076-5908|via=}} == Biography == Yuri Velykanovych was born in a family of teachers Emilia and Dnytro Velykanovych in the village of [[Ilnyk]] (Austria-Hungary, nowadays [[Turka Raion]], [[Lviv Oblast]], [[Ukraine]]) where he graduated from school. Since 1920 he studied in the Ukrainian grammar school in [[Lviv]]. Then he entered the Faculty of Philology at the Jan Kazimierz University (nowadays [[University of Lviv|Ivan Franko National University of Lviv]]). Being a student he joined the Communist Party of Western Ukraine.{{Cite journal|last=Donchenko|first=S. P.|date=2017-08-07|title=The Ukrainians in the civil war in Spain in 1936-1939 years|url=https://grani.org.ua/index.php/journal/article/view/990/1005|journal=Грані|volume=20|issue=6|pages=|issn=2413-8738|via=}} Since the summer of 1936, he is a fighter of the [[International Brigades]] in Spain during the Civil War.{{Cite web|url=http://propaganda-journal.net/9977.html|title=Первый бой фашизму в Испании: участие в этом выходцев из Западной Украины|last=|first=|date=|website=propaganda-journal.net|language=Russian|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-02-03}} Since July 1937, he is a member of the [[Ukrainian interbrigade company Taras Shevchenko|Company named after Taras Shevchenko]] (a part of the [[XII International Brigade|XIII Dabrowski Brigade]]) composed of Ukrainian communists from [[Galicia (Eastern Europe)|Galicia]] and [[Volhynia]].{{Cite news|url=http://uacrisis.org/es/48229-guerra-civil-espanola-1|title=Los ucranianos en la Guerra Civil Española: parte 1 – a favor del bando republicano {{!}} UACRISIS.ORG|date=2016-10-18|work=Ukraine crisis media center|access-date=2018-02-03|language=es-ES}} In the interbrigadist press Velykanovych publishes his articles and correspondence in Polish, Spanish and Ukrainian about [[Taras Shevchenko]]'s life and creativity, about the battle way of the company ("Taras Shevchenko", "The Ukrainians in the International Brigades", "Taras Shevchenko in the Aragon Front" and others). On September 4, 1938, he was mortally wounded in the [[Battle of the Ebro|battle of the Ebro river]]. == Homage == During the Soviet era, in 1982, a monument to Yuri Velykanovych was erected in Lviv. In addition a street received the name of Velykanovych (renamed by the authorities in 1991 after gaining [[Independence of Ukraine|independence]]). On that street there was a school with deep learning of Spanish. In May 2015, the vandals cut off the head of the statue. The monument was dismantled for restoration, and then returned to its place. At night on December 2, 2017, members of the [[Neo-Nazism|neo-Nazi]] group C14 threw the sculpture to the ground, drew the slogan "Down with the communist!" on the pedestal, and left the signature of their gang.{{Cite news|url=https://korrespondent.net/city/lvov/3913295-vo-lvove-povredyly-pamiatnyk-kommunystu-velykanovychu|title="Во Львове повредили памятник коммунисту Великановичу"|last=|first=|date=December 4, 2017|work=Корреспондент.net|access-date=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=Russian}} == Extwernal links == {{Commons cat}} * ''[https://web.archive.org/web/20181016164030/https://morningstaronline.co.uk/article/anger-statue-spanish-civil-war-hero-vandalised Anger as statue of Spanish civil war hero vandalised]'' - the [[International Brigade Memorial Trust]] (IBMT) has condemned the desecration of a monument to a Ukrainian who died in the Spanish ([[Morning Star (British newspaper)|Morning Star]]) == References == {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Velykanovych, Yuri}} [[Category:1910 births]] [[Category:1938 deaths]] [[Category:People from Turka Raion]] [[Category:People from the Kingdom of Galicia and Lodomeria]] [[Category:Communist Party of Western Ukraine members]] [[Category:Ukrainian revolutionaries]] [[Category:Anti-fascists]] [[Category:International Brigades personnel]] [[Category:People of the Spanish Civil War]] [[Category:Foreign volunteers in the Spanish Civil War]] [[Category:Military personnel killed in the Spanish Civil War]]
